news_header: A recent aircraft crash in South Sudan resulted in at least 20 fatalities.
news_text: In South Sudan, a small aircraft crashed in the State of Unity, killing at least 20 people. The aircraft was transporting workers to an oil field when it went down near its destination. Out of 21 people on board, only one survived. The country faces economic and political crises, leading to unreliable transport infrastructure, which has contributed to several aircraft accidents in recent years, often due to overload and adverse weather conditions.
